page.title: 17CHILCOTE MANOR
page.content: {A prebendal manor. Grid Ref: ST585463 Chilcote Manor stands at about l50 metres above sea level, 0.5km south east of the hamlet of{East Horrington. The Manor was built of stone in{l820 using a{gothic style;}later a{clock {tower}was added in{l880 by Tyte of {Wells. }The house faces due west and has fine views across farmland to the cathedral city of Wells. The Manor Estate included Sharcombe Park, Dinder and Chilcote but the Estate was broken up and sold in l925.{The house has l0 {habitable rooms 3 bathrooms, a laundry {and a pantry. }At the rear is a walled stable yard containing 5 stone out- buildings and there is about l acre of garden with a lawn screened from the main entrance by a high wall and gates The walled garden, which is mainly lawn is said to be{haunted by 3 girls. Present owners:{Mr & Mrs Roberts-Wray.
